intro: Galium trachyspermum, commonly known as wild betony, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Galium trachyspermum is often found in woodlands, stream banks, and rocky areas.
